remixlab.dandelion.core

Class MatrixHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.dandelion.core.MatrixHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatrixStackHelper

    public abstract class MatrixHelper
extends Object
    Various matrix operations dandelion should support either through a third-party implementation or locally through the MatrixStackHelper .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MatrixHelper(AbstractScene scn)
      Instantiates the projectionView() matrix and sets isProjectionViewInverseCached() to false.

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Load projection() and modelView() in AbstractScene.preDraw().

      • isProjectionViewInverseCached

        public boolean isProjectionViewInverseCached()
        Returns true if P x M and inv (P x M) are being cached, and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        cacheProjectionView(), cacheProjectionViewInverse(boolean)

      • cacheProjectionViewInverse

        public void cacheProjectionViewInverse(boolean optimise)
        Cache inv (P x M) (and also (P x M) ) so that AbstractScene.unprojectedCoordinatesOf(Vec) is optimized.
        See Also:
        isProjectionViewInverseCached(), cacheProjectionView()

      • projectionView

        public Mat projectionView()
        Returns:
        projection() * modelView().

      • projectionViewInverse

        public Mat projectionViewInverse()
        cacheProjectionViewInverse(boolean) should be called first for this method to take effect.
        Returns:
        inv(projection() * modelView())

      • loadProjection

        public void loadProjection(boolean recompute)
        Same as setProjection(gScene.eye().getProjection(recompute)).

      • loadProjection

        public void loadProjection()
        Computes the projection matrix from AbstractScene.eye() parameters and loads it into the matrix helper. Used in bind().

        Eye.getProjection(boolean)

        public void loadModelView()

        See Also:

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float angle)
        Two dimensional rotation.

        Same as rotateZ (this is identical to a 3D rotation along the z-axis) but included for clarity. It'd be weird for people drawing 2D graphics to be using rotateZ. And they might kick our a-- for the confusion.

        Additional background.

      • rotateX

        public void rotateX(float angle)
        Rotate around the X axis.

        Rotate around the Z axis.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float angle,
                   float vx,
                   float vy,
                   float vz)
        Rotate about a vector in space. Same as the glRotatef() function.

      • scale

        public void scale(float s)
        Scale equally in all dimensions.

      • scale

        public void scale(float sx,
                  float sy)
        Scale in X and Y. Equivalent to scale(sx, sy, 1).

        Not recommended for use in 3D, because the z-dimension is just scaled by 1, since there's no way to know what else to scale it by.

      • scale

        public void scale(float x,
                  float y,
                  float z)
        Scale in X, Y, and Z.

      • beginScreenDrawing

        public void beginScreenDrawing()
        Computes the world coordinates of an screen object so that drawing can be done directly with 2D screen coordinates.

        All screen drawing should be enclosed between beginScreenDrawing() and endScreenDrawing(). Then you can just begin drawing your screen shapes. Attention: If you want your screen drawing to appear on top of your 3d scene then draw first all your 3d before doing any call to a beginScreenDrawing() and endScreenDrawing() pair.

        See Also:
        endScreenDrawing()

      • endScreenDrawing

        public void endScreenDrawing()
        Ends screen drawing. See beginScreenDrawing() for details.
        See Also:
        beginScreenDrawing()
